endemo2.industry.products.Product¶

class Product(product_name, product_input, input_manager, country_name, population, gdp)[source]¶

Bases: object

Holds all information and objects belonging to a product in the industry of a country.

Parameters:

  • product_name (str) – The name of the product type. For example “steel_prim”.

  • product_input (ProductInput) – The product types input from the input manager. (Redundant)

  • input_manager (Input) – The input manager, which holds all input data used to create this product.

  • country_name (str) – The name of the country to whose industry this product belongs to.

  • population (Population) – The countries population amount used to create timeseries per capita.

  • gdp (TimeStepSequence) – The countries gdp used to create timeseries per gdp.

Variables:

  • _name (str) – The name of the product. For example “steel_prim”.

  • _country_name (str) – The name of the country to whose industry this product belongs to.

  • _specific_consumption (SpecificConsumptionData) – The object used to optionally calculate and get the specific consumption amounts for this product type.

  • _bat (EH) – The specific consumption of the best available technology.

  • _perc_used (float) – The percentage of the predicted amount used of this product. Can be configured to model new technology replacing old ones.

  • _exp_change_rate (float) – The manual change rate for the exponential forecast method.

  • _heat_levels (Heat) – The heat levels, that splits the forecasted heat demand into demand at different heat levels, by using fixed percentages.

  • _amount_per_year (Timeseries) – Used to predict the product amount. The x-axis is time in years.

  • _amount_per_gdp (Timeseries) – Used to predict the product amount. The x-axis is the countries’ gdp.

  • _amount_per_capita_per_year (Timeseries) – Used to predict the product amount per capita. The x-axis is time in years.

  • _amount_per_capita_per_gdp (Timeseries) – Used to predict the product amount per capita. The x-axis is time in years.

  • _use_per_capita (bool) – Indicates whether the timeseries that predict amount per capita should be used for the forecast.

  • _use_gdp_as_x (bool) – Indicated whether the timeseries that use the gdp as x-axis should be used for the forecast.

  • _empty (bool) – Indicates that the product historical data is empty. This is true, if the country is being present in the input table but filters causing the list to be empty.

  • _nuts2_installed_capacity (dict[str, float]) – The installed capacity for this product in each NUTS2 region for the country this product belongs to.

calculate_demand(year)[source]¶

Calculates the demand for this product. Returns zero demand when the _empty attribute is true.

\[D(y)[TWh/T] = p*A(y)[T]*(c_{electricity}, c_{heat_{split}}, c_{hydrogen})[TWh/T]\]
Parameters:

year (int) – The target year, the demand should be calculated for.

Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The calculated demand.

split_heat_levels(x)[source]¶

Takes amount of heat as input and splits it into different heat levels, according to the _heat_levels attribute.

Parameters:

Returns:
